de.unihalle.sqlequalizer
Class QueryHandler

java.lang.Object
  de.unihalle.sqlequalizer.QueryHandler

public class QueryHandler
extends java.lang.Object

Class handles exaclty one SQL-Query by parsing him with ZQL-Engine. Afterwards equalize() starts the equalizing/standardization process.

Author:
Robert Hartmann

Method Detail

getCorrectAlias

public java.lang.String getCorrectAlias(java.lang.String data,
                                        java.util.Vector<org.gibello.zql.ZFromItem> fromItems,
                                        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> sub)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
Function gets an Attribute with or without tuple variable and maps this with the correct, automatically generated, tuple variable Used by makeAlias()

Parameters:
data - Attribute that we want to label with the tuple variable
fromItems - All From Tables with their automatically generated tuple variables
sub - HashMap of former renamed tuplevariables to trace back to origin, in case we have an old tuplevariable that was already substituted with the new automatically ones
Returns:
Correct tuple variable and attribute as tuplevariable.attribute
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

makeAliases

public org.gibello.zql.ZExp makeAliases(org.gibello.zql.ZExp exp,
                                        java.util.Vector<org.gibello.zql.ZFromItem> fromItems,
                                        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> sub)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
Basically just does a dfs on the where clause and calling getCorrectAlias(). Also handles Subqueries as it calls the equalize process recursively for each subquery. Used by handleWHEREClause

Parameters:
exp - Root node for current subtree
fromItems - List of all Tables including tuple variables
sub - @see above
Returns:
Subtree under exp with correct Aliases all over including subqueries.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

handleGROUPBYStatement

public org.gibello.zql.ZGroupBy handleGROUPBYStatement(org.gibello.zql.ZGroupBy z)
Handles group by Statement by Sorting Group By List. TODO: Handles having Statement by calling handleWHEREClause() explained in Master Thesis.

Parameters:
z - Group by Statement to be handled
Returns:
Standardized Group by Statement

handleQUERY

public org.gibello.zql.ZQuery[] handleQUERY(org.gibello.zql.ZQuery q)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
Basically handles the whole Query by dividing the work into several pieces, handling them over to helper functions

Parameters:
q - Zquery Object containing the (parsed) SQL-Statement
Returns:
List of Standardized ZQuery Objects. Because of self joins can contain more than one.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

handleFROMClause

public void handleFROMClause(java.util.Vector<org.gibello.zql.ZFromItem> from)
Helper Function to handle FROM Clause by sorting all tables and creating new tuplevariables for each table (iteratively)

Parameters:
from -

handleSELECTClause

public java.util.Vector<org.gibello.zql.ZSelectItem> handleSELECTClause(java.util.Vector<org.gibello.zql.ZSelectItem> sel)
                                                                 throws java.lang.Exception
Handle Select Clause by replacing * to all attributes of tables under FROM. Continues with assigning new tuple variables to each columns

Parameters:
sel - Vector of ZSelectItems forming SELECT Clause
Returns:
Standardized SELECT Clause as Vector
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

tranformToKNF

public org.gibello.zql.ZExp tranformToKNF(org.gibello.zql.ZExp root)
Transforms a Formula to conjunctive normal form (CNF, in german: KNF) Uses OperatorCompression, pushDownNegate, and use distribute law

Parameters:
root - Root node of Formula representing Root Node of WHERE Clause
Returns:
Root Node of Formula in CNF

handleWHEREClause

public org.gibello.zql.ZExp handleWHEREClause(org.gibello.zql.ZExp zexp,
                                              java.util.Vector<org.gibello.zql.ZFromItem> from,
                                              QueryHandler q,
                                              java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> substis)
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
Handles WHERE Clause. Basically done by helper functions. See Master Thesis for detailed explanation of standardization process

Parameters:
zexp - Root Node representing WHERE formula
from - All Tables under FROM with Tuplevariables
q - Whole QueryHandler object of current Query
substis - @see above
Returns:
Standardized WHERE formulas root node
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

setOriginalStatement

public void setOriginalStatement(java.lang.String s)
                          throws org.gibello.zql.ParseException
Sets the start query to be handled by parsing it with ZQL-Parser Engine and setting a working copy as well that will be changed throughout the process

Parameters:
s - String representing the SQL-Query
Throws:
org.gibello.zql.ParseException

createTable

public boolean createTable(java.lang.String createTableStatement)

equalize

public org.gibello.zql.ZQuery[] equalize(boolean respect)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
Starts the whole equalization/standardization

Parameters:
respect - Shall the Columnorder in SELECT Clause be respected?
Returns:
Array of ZQueries that are standardized. Can be more than one, when self joins are used. @see Master Thesis for detailed information.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
